body:
I wouldn't be very pleased to see Go programs littered with "// vet:ignore"
comments. In general we try to avoid magic comments as much as we can.

On 8 May 2015 at 07:55, Adam Sadovsky <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> "go vet" sometimes reports false positives. It would be nice if code could
> be annotated with something like "// vet:ignore" to make it so "go vet"
> does not report errors associated with that line of code, perhaps for a
> particular specified error type.
>
> (I searched to see if this option exists, but couldn't find anything.)
